Class CWSavingConstructive

java.lang.Object
com.instancesobp.batchingAlgorithm.BatchingAlgorithm
com.instancesobp.batchingAlgorithm.constructiveHeuristic.ConstructiveAlgorithm
com.instancesobp.batchingAlgorithm.constructiveHeuristic.CWSavingConstructive
All Implemented Interfaces:
Serializable
public class CWSavingConstructive extends ConstructiveAlgorithm
Implements the Clarke and Wright Savings constructive heuristic algorithm for batching orders. This algorithm groups orders into batches while minimizing the total cost or distance. It uses an objective function to evaluate the quality of the batches.
Version:
1.0
Author:
Sergio Gil Borr√°s

  • Method Details

    • run

      public List<Batch> run(List<Order> orderList) throws Exception
      Executes the Clarke and Wright Savings algorithm to create batches from a list of orders.
      Specified by:
      run in class ConstructiveAlgorithm
      Parameters:
      orderList - The list of initial orders to be batched.
      Returns:
      A list of batches created by the algorithm.
      Throws:
      Exception - If an error occurs during the batching process.

    • initializeBatchList

      public ArrayList<Batch> initializeBatchList(List<Order> initialOrders) throws Exception
      Initializes a list of batches, each containing a single order.
      Parameters:
      initialOrders - The list of initial orders to be batched.
      Returns:
      A list of batches, each containing one order.
      Throws:
      Exception - If an error occurs during the initialization process.

    • combineBestBatches

      public ArrayList<Batch> combineBestBatches(ArrayList<Batch> batchList) throws Exception
      Combines the two best batches based on the savings calculated by the objective function.
      Parameters:
      batchList - The current list of batches.
      Returns:
      A new list of batches after combining the best two batches, or null if no combination is possible.
      Throws:
      Exception - If an error occurs during the combination process.
